result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J. Collier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
Good time.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: No alcohol, no prescription drugs, except those prescribed to defendant.

Remit fines & costs.
Any assessments, treatments and follow through as determined by agent.
May satisfy probation in Brown Co Mental Health Court, if accepted.
If agent believes defendant can be released from probation after 1 year, may petition to do so.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy J. Collier

Defendant Jeremy J. Collier in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Jeremy J. Collier in custody.  Kent Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Def addresses the court
Atty Hansen spks- ready to plea today
ADA spks on agreement
Court arraigns def on ct 1
Def pleads n/c
Federal firearm warning
Off the record--Atty Hansen goes over plea quest again with def
Plea quest/WOR
Fact basis
Court finds def guilty- ct 1
Court dismisses and reads in ct 2
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Hansen spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes: 
Imposed and stayed: 9 months jail with good time and huber release, if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. 8 days credit.
2 year probation:
Remit fines and cost
No alcohol, no prescription drugs, except those prescribed to def
Any assessments, treatments, and follow through as determined by agent
May satisfy probation in Brown Co. Mental Health Court, if accepted
If agent believes def can be released from probation after 1 year, may petition to do so
Appeal rights

Attorney Brad Hansen in court.  Kent Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court will not accept plea today if def shows up later
